FeedItems.Title: Announcing ASP.NET Core in .NET 5
FeedItems.Summary: .NET 5 is now released! .NET 5 is the next version of .NET Core and the future of the .NET platform. With .NET 5 you have everything you need to build rich, interactive front end web UI and powerful...

FeedItems.Title: Unified Blazor UI in the Mobile Blazor Bindings Preview 5
FeedItems.Summary: I’m excited to announce that today we are releasing the Mobile Blazor Bindings Preview 5 update that adds support for sharing UI between web apps and mobile/desktop apps. You can now use a Razor...

FeedItems.Title: ASP.NET Core updates in .NET 5 Release Candidate 2
FeedItems.Summary: .NET 5 Release Candidate 2 (RC2) is now available and is ready for evaluation. .NET 5 RC2 is a “go live” release, meaning it’s supported in production. This prerelease of .NET 5 is...

FeedItems.Title: Azure Static Web Apps with .NET and Blazor
FeedItems.Summary: Azure Static Web Apps is a service that automatically builds and deploys full stack web apps from a GitHub repository. Azure Static Web Apps consist of a static web frontend, and an Azure Functions...

FeedItems.Title: Free e-book: Blazor for ASP.NET Web Forms Developers
FeedItems.Summary: We are thrilled to announce the release of our new e-book: Blazor for ASP.NET Web Forms developers. This book caters specifically to ASP.NET Web Forms developers looking for guidelines. As well as...

FeedItems.Title: ASP.NET Core updates in .NET 5 Preview 8
FeedItems.Summary:
.NET 5 Preview 8 is now available and is ready for evaluation. Here’s what’s new in this release:
Azure Active Directory authentication with Microsoft.Identity.Web
CSS isolation for Blazor...

FeedItems.Title: Hybrid Blazor apps in the Mobile Blazor Bindings July update
FeedItems.Summary:
I’m excited to announce we are releasing the Mobile Blazor Bindings July update! This release adds support for building Hybrid Blazor apps, which contain both native and web UI.
Hybrid apps are...

Issues.Title: [master] Update dependencies from dotnet/arcade
Issues.Body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

[marker]: <> (Begin:46dbaed2-da9c-49ba-d45f-08d76e1d3434)
## From https://github.com/dotnet/arcade
- **Subscription**: 46dbaed2-da9c-49ba-d45f-08d76e1d3434
- **Build**: 20210113.4
- **Date Produced**: 1/13/2021 5:21 PM
- **Commit**: d01f08a47a14c3842f5f74e14e6a6a8b7b7a5593
- **Branch**: refs/heads/release/3.x

[DependencyUpdate]: <> (Begin)

- **Updates**:
  - **Microsoft.DotNet.Arcade.Sdk**: [from 1.0.0-beta.20113.5 to 1.0.0-beta.21063.4][1]

[1]: https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/compare/15f00ef...d01f08a

[DependencyUpdate]: <> (End)


[marker]: <> (End:46dbaed2-da9c-49ba-d45f-08d76e1d3434)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/arcade" (#2050)

Issues.Title: Remove Upload Test Results Build Step
Issues.Body:
Goal being to remove the path not found warning in AZDO CI.
https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/pull/23046#issuecomment-646364845

The CI now reports a successful (green) status:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14852843/85089730-3a54c200-b198-11ea-842f-f34e4ac7c510.png)


Note the following warning for no `.xml` files found in the test upload step is now shown.
https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_build/results?buildId=695273&view=logs&j=0bc77094-9fcd-5c38-f6e4-27d2ae131589&t=06f525b6-1103-55ff-8b74-f96f9e995ef4&l=11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove Upload Test Results Build Step" (#2049)

Issues.Title: Fix Build Artifacts Publish Warning
Issues.Body:
Running through CI to test effectiveness.

Inspired by: https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/pull/23046 / https://github.com/dotnet/aspnetcore/pull/23046#pullrequestreview-432653066
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix Build Artifacts Publish Warning" (#2048)

Issues.Title: Migrate DebugProxy to dotnet/blazor repo
Issues.Body: This PR migrates to DebugProxy code currently in dotnet/aspnetcore into this repo so that we can take advantage of some of the automation that is in place to automatically take the latest Mono bits.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Migrate DebugProxy to dotnet/blazor repo" (#2047)
